original_title: Soldier at Panagoda army camp takes his own life
original_body_lines: A soldier attached to the army camp in Panagoda committed suicide today (Feb 24) by shooting himself.
According to the army spokesperson, the soldier in question had used his service weapon, a T-56 firearm, to take his own life.
The 32-year-old is reportedly a resident of Naula area in Matale.
The reason for the suicide was not immediately clear. However, Homagama Police has initiated probes into the matter.
If you or someone you know is in crisis and needs help, resources are available for immediate support:
- For emergencies contact the National Mental Health Helpline 1926
